info.title: Square Connect API
info.description: Client library for accessing the Square Connect APIs

personal_access_token.description: Access token for accessing a single Square Account
personal_access_token.name: Authorization

scopes.MERCHANT_PROFILE_READ: GET endpoints related to a merchant's business and location entities. Almost all Connect API applications need this permission in order to obtain a merchant's location IDs.
scopes.PAYMENTS_READ: GET endpoints related to transactions and refunds.
scopes.PAYMENTS_WRITE: POST, PUT, and DELETE endpoints related to transactions and refunds. E-commerce applications must request this permission.
scopes.CUSTOMERS_READ: GET endpoints related to customer management.
scopes.CUSTOMERS_WRITE: POST, PUT, and DELETE endpoints related to customer management.
scopes.BANK_ACCOUNTS_READ: GET endpoints related to a merchant's bank accounts.
scopes.ITEMS_READ: GET endpoints related to a merchant's item library.
scopes.ITEMS_WRITE: POST, PUT, and DELETE endpoints related to a merchant's item library.
scopes.ORDERS_READ: GET endpoints related to a merchant's Square online store.
scopes.ORDERS_WRITE: POST, PUT, and DELETE endpoints related to a merchant's Square online store.
scopes.EMPLOYEES_READ: GET endpoints related to employee management.
scopes.EMPLOYEES_WRITE: POST, PUT, and DELETE endpoints related to employee management.
scopes.TIMECARDS_READ: GET endpoints related to employee timecards.
scopes.TIMECARDS_WRITE: POST, PUT, and DELETE endpoints related to employee timecards.

post.summary: Exchange an Authorization code for an Access Token
post.description: Exchange an Authorization code for an Access Token

parameters.name: AccessTokenRequest
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.description: Your Application ID.

parameters.name: AccessTokenRenewRequest
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: Get a business's information.
get.description: Get a business's information.

get.summary: Provides details for a business's locations, including their IDs.
get.description: Provides details for a business's locations, including their IDs.

post.summary: Creates an employee for a business.
post.description: Creates an employee for a business.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: Provides summary information for all of a business's employees.
get.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's employees.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order in which employees are listed in the response, based on their created_at field.      Default value: ASC

parameters.name: begin_updated_at
parameters.description: If filtering results by their updated_at field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: end_updated_at
parameters.description: If filtering results by there updated_at field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: begin_created_at
parameters.description: If filtering results by their created_at field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: end_created_at
parameters.description: If filtering results by their created_at field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If provided, the endpoint returns only employee entities with the specified status (ACTIVE or INACTIVE).

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: If provided, the endpoint returns only employee entities with the specified external_id.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum integer number of employee entities to return in a single response. Default 100, maximum 200.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

get.summary: Provides the details for a single employee.
get.description: Provides the details for a single employee.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: The employee's ID.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the role to modify.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

post.summary: Creates a timecard for an employee. Each timecard corresponds to a single shift.
post.description: Creates a timecard for an employee. Each timecard corresponds to a single shift.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: Provides summary information for all of a business's employee timecards.
get.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's employee timecards.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order in which timecards are listed in the response, based on their created_at field.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: If provided, the endpoint returns only timecards for the employee with the specified ID.

parameters.name: begin_clockin_time
parameters.description: If filtering results by their clockin_time field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: end_clockin_time
parameters.description: If filtering results by their clockin_time field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: begin_clockout_time
parameters.description: If filtering results by their clockout_time field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: end_clockout_time
parameters.description: If filtering results by their clockout_time field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: begin_updated_at
parameters.description: If filtering results by their updated_at field, the beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: end_updated_at
parameters.description: If filtering results by their updated_at field, the end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: If true, only deleted timecards are returned. If false, only valid timecards are returned.If you don't provide this parameter, both valid and deleted timecards are returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum integer number of employee entities to return in a single response. Default 100, maximum 200.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

get.summary: Provides the details for a single timecard.
get.description: Provides the details for a single timecard.

parameters.name: timecard_id
parameters.description: The timecard's ID.

put.summary: Modifies a timecard's details. This creates an API_EDIT event for the timecard. You can view a timecard's event history with the List Timecard Events endpoint.
put.description: Modifies a timecard's details. This creates an API_EDIT event for the timecard. You can view a timecard's event history with the List Timecard Events endpoint.

parameters.name: timecard_id
parameters.description: TThe ID of the timecard to modify.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

delete.summary: Deletes a timecard. Deleted timecards are still accessible from Connect API endpoints, but the value of their deleted field is set to true. See Handling deleted timecards for more information.
delete.description: Deletes a timecard. Deleted timecards are still accessible from Connect API endpoints, but the value of their deleted field is set to true. See Handling deleted timecards for more information.

parameters.name: timecard_id
parameters.description: The ID of the timecard to delete.

get.summary: Provides summary information for all events associated with a particular timecard.
get.description: Provides summary information for all events associated with a particular timecard.

parameters.name: timecard_id
parameters.description: The ID of the timecard to list events for.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

get.summary: Provides the details for all of a location's cash drawer shifts during a date range. The date range you specify cannot exceed 90 days.
get.description: Provides the details for all of a location's cash drawer shifts during a date range. The date range you specify cannot exceed 90 days.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list cash drawer shifts for.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order in which cash drawer shifts are listed in the response, based on their created_at field. Default value: ASC

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. Default value: The current time minus 90 days.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. Default value: The current time.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

get.summary: Provides the details for a single cash drawer shift, including all events that occurred during the shift.
get.description: Provides the details for a single cash drawer shift, including all events that occurred during the shift.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list cash drawer shifts for.

parameters.name: shift_id
parameters.description: The shift's ID.

get.summary: Provides summary information for all payments taken by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length. See Date ranges for details of inclusive and exclusive dates.
get.description: Provides summary information for all payments taken by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length. See Date ranges for details of inclusive and exclusive dates.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list payments for. If you specify me, this endpoint returns payments aggregated from all of the business's locations.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: TThe order in which payments are listed in the response.

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is before January 1, 2013 (2013-01-01T00:00:00Z), this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time minus one year.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is more than one year greater than begin_time, this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of payments to return in a single response. This value cannot exceed 200.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

get.summary: Provides comprehensive information for a single payment.
get.description: Provides comprehensive information for a single payment.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the payment's associated location.

parameters.name: payment_id
parameters.description: The payment's Square-issued ID. You obtain this value from Payment objects returned by the List Payments endpoint, or Settlement objects returned by the List Settlements endpoint.

get.summary: Provides summary information for all deposits and withdrawals initiated by Square to a merchant's bank account during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.
get.description: Provides summary information for all deposits and withdrawals initiated by Square to a merchant's bank account during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list settlements for. If you specify me, this endpoint returns payments aggregated from all of the business's locations.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: TThe order in which payments are listed in the response.

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is before January 1, 2013 (2013-01-01T00:00:00Z), this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time minus one year.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is more than one year greater than begin_time, this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of payments to return in a single response. This value cannot exceed 200.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Provide this parameter to retrieve only settlements with a particular status (SENT or FAILED).

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

get.summary: Provides comprehensive information for a single settlement, including the entries that contribute to the settlement's total.
get.description: Provides comprehensive information for a single settlement, including the entries that contribute to the settlement's total.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the settlements's associated location.

parameters.name: settlement_id
parameters.description: The settlement's Square-issued ID. You obtain this value from Settlement objects returned by the List Settlements endpoint.

get.summary: Provides the details for all refunds initiated by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.
get.description: Provides the details for all refunds initiated by a merchant or any of the merchant's mobile staff during a date range. Date ranges cannot exceed one year in length.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list refunds for.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: TThe order in which payments are listed in the response.

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is before January 1, 2013 (2013-01-01T00:00:00Z), this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time minus one year.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in ISO 8601 format. If this value is more than one year greater than begin_time, this endpoint returns an error. Default value: The current time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of payments to return in a single response. This value cannot exceed 200.

Link.description: If returned, there are too many items to return in one request and you must paginate with the supplied link.

post.summary: Issues a refund for a previously processed payment. You must issue a refund within 60 days of the associated payment.
post.description: Issues a refund for a previously processed payment. You must issue a refund within 60 days of the associated payment.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the original payment's associated location.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

put.summary: Updates the details of an online store order. Every update you perform on an order corresponds to one of three actions:
put.description: Updates the details of an online store order. Every update you perform on an order corresponds to one of three actions:

get.summary: Provides non-confidential details for all of a location's associated bank accounts. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.
get.description: Provides non-confidential details for all of a location's associated bank accounts. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.

get.summary: Provides non-confidential details for a merchant's associated bank account. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.
get.description: Provides non-confidential details for a merchant's associated bank account. This endpoint does not provide full bank account numbers, and there is no way to obtain a full bank account number with the Connect API.

parameters.name: bank_account_id

put.summary: Associates a fee with an item, meaning the fee is automatically applied to the item in Square Register.
put.description: Associates a fee with an item, meaning the fee is automatically applied to the item in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the fee's associated location.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to add the fee to.

parameters.name: fee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the fee to apply.

delete.summary: Removes a fee assocation from an item, meaning the fee is no longer automatically applied to the item in Square Register.
delete.description: Removes a fee assocation from an item, meaning the fee is no longer automatically applied to the item in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the fee's associated location.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to add the fee to.

parameters.name: fee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the fee to apply.

post.summary: Creates a Favorites page in Square Register.
post.description: Creates a Favorites page in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to create an item for.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: Lists all of a location's Favorites pages in Square Register.
get.description: Lists all of a location's Favorites pages in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list Favorites pages for.

put.summary: Modifies the details of a Favorites page in Square Register.
put.description: Modifies the details of a Favorites page in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Favorites page's associated location

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the page to modify.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

delete.summary: Deletes an existing Favorites page and all of its cells.
delete.description: Deletes an existing Favorites page and all of its cells.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Favorites page's associated location.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the page to delete.

put.summary: Modifies a cell of a Favorites page in Square Register.
put.description: Modifies a cell of a Favorites page in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Favorites page's associated location.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the page the cell belongs to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

delete.summary: Deletes a cell from a Favorites page in Square Register.
delete.description: Deletes a cell from a Favorites page in Square Register.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Favorites page's associated location.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the page to delete.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: The row of the cell to clear. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive. Row 0 is the top row.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The column of the cell to clear. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive. Column 0 is the leftmost column.

post.summary: Charge
post.description: Charges a card represented by a token.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to associate the transaction with.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: ListTransactions
get.description:
Lists transactions for a particular location.

When making a request to this endpoint, your request body **must** include either the `cursor` parameter, or it must
include both `begin_time` and `end_time` with an optional `sort_order`.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list transactions for.

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description:
The order in which results are listed in the response (`ASC` for
chronological, `DESC` for reverse-chronological).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

post.summary: CreateRefund
post.description: Initiates a refund for a previously charged tender.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the original transaction's associated location.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: ListRefunds
get.description: Lists refunds for one of a business's locations.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location to list refunds for.

parameters.name: begin_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: The order in which results are listed in the response.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

get.summary: ListLocations
get.description: Provides summary information for all of a business's locations.

post.summary: CreateCustomer
post.description: Creates a new customer for the business, which can have associated cards on file.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: ListCustomers
get.description: Lists a business's customers.

put.description: Updates the details of an existing customer.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The customer to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

get.summary: RetrieveCustomer
get.description: Returns details for a single customer.

delete.description: Deletes a customer from a business.

post.summary: CreateCustomerCard
post.description: Adds a card on file to an existing customer.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.

delete.description: Removes a card on file from a customer.

post.summary: CaptureTransaction
post.description:
Captures a transaction that was created with the **Charge**
endpoint with a `delay_capture` value of `true`.

post.summary: VoidTransaction
post.description:
Cancels a transaction that was created with the **Charge**
endpoint with a `delay_capture` value of `true`.

get.summary: RetrieveTransaction
get.description: Retrieves details for a single transaction.

TenderCardDetailsEntryMethod.description: The method used to read the card

TransactionProduct.description: The name of the product used to accept payment for this transaction

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

CaptureTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CaptureTransaction** endpoint.

id.description: The card's unique ID, if any.

last_4.description: The last 4 digits of the card's number.

exp_month.description: The month of the card's expiration date, which must be between 1-12.

exp_year.description: The year of the card's expiration date, which must be a 4-digit year.

cardholder_name.description: The cardholder name for the card on file.

billing_address.description: The billing address for the card on file.

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
transaction among transactions you've created.

If you're unsure whether a particular transaction succeeded,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about double-charging the buyer. Note that *all other fields*
must also remain identical in your followup request, or an error will occur.

amount_money.description: The amount of money to collect in the transaction.

card_nonce.description:
A nonce representing the credit card to charge for this transaction.
Do not provide a value for this field if you provide a value for
`customer_card_id`.

customer_card_id.description:
The ID of the customer card on file to charge for this transaction. Do
not provide a value for this field if you provide a value for `card_nonce`.

delay_capture.description:
If `true`, the request will only perform an Auth on the provided
card. You can then later perform either a Capture (with the
*CaptureTransaction** endpoint) or a Void (with the **VoidTransation**
endpoint.

reference_id.description:
An optional ID you can associate with the transaction for your own
purposes (such as to associate the transaction with an entity ID in your
own database).

note.description: An optional note to associate with the transaction.

customer_id.description:
The ID of the customer to associate this transaction with. This field
is required if you provide a value for `customer_card_id`, and optional
otherwise.

billing_address.description: If available, Postal code in the billing address for US and Canada payments may reduce decline rate.

ChargeRequest.description:
Defines the parameters that can be included in the body of
a request to the **Charge** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

transaction.description: The details of the created transaction.

ChargeResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **Charge** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `transaction` is present in a given response (never both).

card_nonce.description: A card nonce representing the card data to link to the customer.

billing_address.description: Postal code in the address is required for US and Canada payments.

CreateCustomerCardResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CreateCustomerCard** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `card` is present in a given response (never both).

CreateCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CreateCustomer** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
refund among refunds you've created for the tender.

If you're unsure whether a particular refund succeeded,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about duplicating the refund.

tender_id.description: The ID of the tender to refund.

reason.description: A description of the reason for the refund.

amount_money.description: The amount of money to refund.

CreateRefundRequest.description:
Defines the body parameters that can be included in
a request to the **CreateRefund** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

refund.description: The details of the created refund.

CreateRefundResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CreateRefund** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `refund` is present in a given response (never both).

created_at.description: The time when the customer was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the customer was updated, in RFC 3339 format.

cards.description: Cards on file for the customer.

DeleteCustomerCardResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **DeleteCustomerCard** endpoint.

DeleteCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **DeleteCustomer** endpoint.

ListCustomersResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **ListCustomers** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customers` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

locations.description: An array of the business's locations.

ListLocationsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of 
a request to the **ListLocations** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `locations` is present in a given response (never both).

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

sort_order.description: The order in which results are listed in the response.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

ListRefundsRequest.description:
Defines the query parameters that can be included in
a request to the **ListRefunds** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

refunds.description: An array of refunds that match your query.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor for retrieving the next set of results,
if any remain.

Provide this value as the `cursor` parameter in a subsequent request
to the **ListTenderRefunds** endpoint.

ListRefundsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **ListTenderRefunds** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `refunds` is present in a given response (never both).

begin_time.description: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

end_time.description: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format.

sort_order.description:
The order in which results are listed in the response (`ASC` for
chronological, `DESC` for reverse-chronological).

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results for your
original query to the endpoint.

ListTransactionsRequest.description:
Defines the query parameters that can be included in
a request to the **ListTransactions** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

transactions.description: An array of transactions that match your query.

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor for retrieving the next set of results,
if any remain.

Provide this value as the `cursor` parameter in a subsequent request
to the **ListTransactions** endpoint.

ListTransactionsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **ListTransactions** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `transactions` is present in a given response (never both).

name.description: The name given to the location.

timezone.description: The IANA Timezone Database identifier for the location's timezone.

capabilities.description:
Indicates which Square features are enabled for the location.

Currently, there is only one value that might be present in this array:
`CREDIT_CARD_PROCESSING`.

Location.description: Represents one of a business's locations.

amount.description:
Amount in the lowest denominated value of this Currency. E.g. in USD
these are cents, in JPY they are Yen (which do not have a 'cent' concept).

id.description: The unique ID of the refund.

location_id.description: The ID of the refund's associated location.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the transaction refunded.

tender_id.description: The ID of the tender refunded.

created_at.description: The time when the refund was created, in RFC 3339 format.

reason.description: The reason for the refund being issued.

processing_fee_money.description: The amount of processing fee refunded.

RetrieveCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveCustomer** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

transaction.description: The details of the requested transaction.

RetrieveTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveTransaction** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `transaction` is present in a given response (never both).

location_id.description: The ID of the tender's associated location.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the tender's associated transaction.

created_at.description: The time when the tender was created, in RFC 3339 format.

note.description: An optional note associated with the tender at the time of payment.

processing_fee_money.description: The amount of any Square processing fees applied to the tender.

customer_id.description:
If the tender represents a customer's card on file, this is
the ID of the associated customer.

card_details.description:
The details of the card tender.
This value is present only if the value of `type` is `CARD`.

cash_details.description:
The details of the cash tender.
This value is present only if the value of `type` is `CASH`.

Tender.description: Represents a form of tender used to pay in a transaction.

status.description: The credit card payment's current state (such as `CAPTURED`)

entry_method.description: The method used to read the card.

TenderCardDetails.description: Represents the details of a credit card tender.

buyer_tendered_money.description: The total amount provided by the buyer for this tender, before change is given.

change_back_money.description: The change returned to the buyer for this tender. This amount should be >= 0.

TenderCashDetails.description: Represents the details of a cash tender.

location_id.description: The ID of the transaction's associated location.

created_at.description: The time when the transaction was created, in RFC 3339 format.

tenders.description: Descriptions of the tenders used to pay for the transaction.

refunds.description: An array of any refunds associated with the transaction.

reference_id.description:
If the transaction was created with the **Charge** endpoint, this
value is the same as the value provided as the `reference_id` parameter
in the request to that endpoint.

product.description: The product that processed the transaction.

Transaction.description:
Represents a transaction processed with Square, either with the
Connect API or with Square Register.

UpdateCustomerResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **UpdateCustomer** endpoint.

One of `errors` or `customer` is present in a given response (never both).

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

VoidTransactionResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CaptureTransaction** endpoint.

access_token.description: The Access Token you'll use to make API calls.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

name.description: The name associated with the merchant account.

email.description: The email address associated with the merchant account.

account_type.description: Indicates whether the merchant account corresponds to a single-location account (LOCATION) or a business account (BUSINESS). This value is almost always LOCATION.

account_capabilities.description: Capabilities that are enabled for the merchant's Square account. Capabilities that are not listed in this array are not enabled for the account.

country_code.description: The country associated with the merchant account, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

language_code.description: The language associated with the merchant account, in BCP 47 format.

currency_code.description: The currency associated with the merchant account, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD.

business_name.description: The name of the merchant's business.

business_address.description: The address of the merchant's business.

business_phone.description: The phone number of the merchant's business.

business_type.description: The type of business operated by the merchant.

nickname.description: The nickname assigned to the single-location account by the parent business. This value appears in the parent business's multi-location dashboard.

location_details.description: Additional information for a single-location account specified by its associated business account, if it has one.

market_url.description: The URL of the merchant's online store.

v1Merchant.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **RetrieveBusiness** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

locations.description: An array of locations in your business.

v1ListLocationsResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the **CaptureTransaction** endpoint.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

role_ids.description: The ids of the employee's associated roles. Currently, you can specify only one or zero roles per employee.

authorized_location_ids.description: The IDs of the locations the employee is allowed to clock in at.

status.description: CWhether the employee is ACTIVE or INACTIVE. Inactive employees cannot sign in to Square Register.Merchants update this field from the Square Dashboard.

external_id.description: An ID the merchant can set to associate the employee with an entity in another system.

created_at.description: The time when the employee entity was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the employee entity was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

is_owner.description: If true, employees with this role have all permissions, regardless of the values indicated in permissions.

created_at.description: The time when the employee entity was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the employee entity was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee the timecard is associated with.

deleted.description: If true, the timecard was deleted by the merchant, and it is no longer valid.

clockin_time.description: The clock-in time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The clock-out time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

clockin_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked in from, if any.

clockout_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked out from. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

created_at.description: The time when the timecard was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the timecard was most recently updated, in ISO 8601 format.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

event_type.description: The ID of the timecard to list events for.

clockin_time.description: The time the employee clocked in, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The time the employee clocked out, in ISO 8601 format.

created_at.description: The time when the event was created, in ISO 8601 format.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that created the event.

event_type.description: The type of event that occurred.

event_money.description: The amount of money that was added to or removed from the cash drawer because of the event. This value can be positive (for added money) or negative (for removed money).

created_at.description: The time when the event occurred, in ISO 8601 format.

description.description: An optional description of the event, entered by the employee that created it.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

opened_at.description: The time when the shift began, in ISO 8601 format.

ended_at.description: The time when the shift ended, in ISO 8601 format.

closed_at.description: The time when the shift was closed, in ISO 8601 format.

employee_ids.description: The IDs of all employees that were logged into Square Register at some point during the cash drawer shift.

opening_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that started the cash drawer shift.

ending_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that ended the cash drawer shift.

closing_employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that closed the cash drawer shift by auditing the cash drawer's contents.

description.description: The time when the timecard was created, in ISO 8601 format.

starting_cash_money.description: The amount of money in the cash drawer at the start of the shift.

cash_payment_money.description: The amount of money added to the cash drawer from cash payments.

cash_refunds_money.description: The amount of money removed from the cash drawer from cash refunds. This value is always negative or zero.

cash_paid_in_money.description: The amount of money added to the cash drawer for reasons other than cash payments.

cash_paid_out_money.description: The amount of money removed from the cash drawer for reasons other than cash refunds.

expected_cash_money.description: The amount of money that should be in the cash drawer at the end of the shift, based on the shift's other money amounts.

closed_cash_money.description: The amount of money found in the cash drawer at the end of the shift by an auditing employee.

device.description: The device running Square Register that was connected to the cash drawer.

events.description: All of the events (payments, refunds, and so on) that involved the cash drawer during the shift.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

merchant_id.description: The unique identifier of the merchant that took the payment.

created_at.description: The time when the payment was created, in ISO 8601 format.

creator_id.description: The unique identifier of the Square account that took the payment.

device.description: The device that took the payment.

payment_url.description: The URL of the payment's detail page in the merchant dashboard. The merchant must be signed in to the merchant dashboard to view this page.

receipt_url.description: The URL of the receipt for the payment. Note that for split tender payments, this URL corresponds to the receipt for the first tender listed in the payment's tender field. Each Tender object has its own receipt_url field you can use to get the other receipts associated with a split tender payment.

inclusive_tax_money.description: The sum of all inclusive taxes associated with the payment.

additive_tax_money.description: The sum of all additive taxes associated with the payment.

tax_money.description: The total of all taxes applied to the payment. This is always the sum of inclusive_tax_money and additive_tax_money.

tip_money.description: The total of all tips applied to the payment.

discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the payment.

processing_fee_money.description: The total of all processing fees collected by Square for the payment.

net_total_money.description: The amount to be deposited into the merchant's bank account for the payment.

refunded_money.description: The total of all refunds applied to the payment.

inclusive_tax.description: All of the inclusive taxes associated with the payment.

additive_tax.description: All of the additive taxes associated with the payment.

tender.description: All of the additive taxes associated with the payment.

refunds.description: All of the refunds applied to the payment.

itemizations.description: The items purchased in the payment.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item purchased. This can be a decimal value.

itemization_type.description: The type of purchase that the itemization represents, such as an ITEM or CUSTOM_AMOUNT

item_detail.description: Details of the item, including its unique identifier and the identifier of the item variation purchased.

notes.description: Notes entered by the merchant about the item at the time of payment, if any.

item_variation_name.description: The name of the item variation purchased, if any.

total_money.description: The total cost of the item, including all taxes and discounts.

single_quantity_money.description: The cost of a single unit of this item.

gross_sales_money.description: The total cost of the itemization and its modifiers, not including taxes or discounts.

discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the itemization. This value is always negative or zero.

net_sales_money.description: The sum of gross_sales_money and discount_money.

taxes.description: All taxes applied to this itemization.

discounts.description: All discounts applied to this itemization.

modifiers.description: All modifier options applied to this itemization.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this modifier option adds to the payment.

modifier_option_id.description: TThe ID of the applied modifier option, if available. Modifier options applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this discount adds to the payment (note that this value is always negative or zero).

discount_id.description: The ID of the applied discount, if available. Discounts applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

category_name.description: The name of the item's merchant-defined category, if any.

sku.description: The item's merchant-defined SKU, if any.

item_id.description: The unique ID of the item purchased, if any.

item_variation_id.description: The unique ID of the item variation purchased, if any.

reason.description: The merchant-specified reason for the refund.

refunded_money.description: The amount of money refunded. This amount is always negative.

created_at.description: The time when the merchant initiated the refund for Square to process, in ISO 8601 format..

processed_at.description: The time when Square processed the refund on behalf of the merchant, in ISO 8601 format.

payment_id.description: The Square-issued ID of the payment the refund is applied to.

total_money.description: The amount of money involved in the settlement. A positive amount indicates a deposit, and a negative amount indicates a withdrawal. This amount is never zero.

initiated_at.description: The time when the settlement was submitted for deposit or withdrawal, in ISO 8601 format.

bank_account_id.description: The Square-issued unique identifier for the bank account associated with the settlement.

entries.description: The entries included in this settlement.

amount_money.description: The total amount of money this entry contributes to the total settlement amount.

fee_money.description: The amount of all Square fees associated with this settlement entry. This value is always negative or zero.

name.description: A human-readable description of the tender.

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that processed the tender.

receipt_url.description: The URL of the receipt for the tender.

card_brand.description: The brand of credit card provided.

pan_suffix.description: The last four digits of the provided credit card's account number.

payment_note.description: Notes entered by the merchant about the tender at the time of payment, if any. Typically only present for tender with the type: OTHER.

total_money.description: The total amount of money provided in this form of tender.

tendered_money.description: The amount of total_money applied to the payment.

change_back_money.description: The amount of total_money returned to the buyer as change.

refunded_money.description: The total of all refunds applied to this tender. This amount is always negative or zero.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

name.description: The merchant-defined name of the tax.

applied_money.description: The amount of money that this tax adds to the payment.

rate.description: The rate of the tax, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%.

inclusion_type.description: Whether the tax is an ADDITIVE tax or an INCLUSIVE tax.

fee_id.description: The ID of the tax, if available. Taxes applied in older versions of Square Register might not have an ID.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

buyer_email.description: The email address of the order's buyer.

recipient_name.description: The name of the order's buyer.

recipient_phone_number.description: The phone number to use for the order's delivery.

state.description: Whether the tax is an ADDITIVE tax or an INCLUSIVE tax.

shipping_address.description: The address to ship the order to.

subtotal_money.description: The amount of all items purchased in the order, before taxes and shipping.

total_shipping_money.description: The shipping cost for the order.

total_tax_money.description: The total of all taxes applied to the order.

total_price_money.description: The total cost of the order.

total_discount_money.description: The total of all discounts applied to the order.

created_at.description: The time when the order was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: The time when the order was last modified, in ISO 8601 format.

expires_at.description: The time when the order expires if no action is taken, in ISO 8601 format.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment associated with the order.

buyer_note.description: A note provided by the buyer when the order was created, if any.

completed_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to COMPLETED, if any

refunded_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to REFUNDED, if any.

canceled_note.description: A note provided by the merchant when the order's state was set to CANCELED, if any.

tender.description: The tender used to pay for the order.

order_history.description: The history of actions associated with the order.

promo_code.description: The promo code provided by the buyer, if any.

btc_receive_address.description: For Bitcoin transactions, the address that the buyer sent Bitcoin to.

btc_price_satoshi.description: For Bitcoin transactions, the price of the buyer's order in satoshi (100 million satoshi equals 1 BTC).

action.description: The type of action performed on the order.

created_at.description: The time when the action was performed, in ISO 8601 format.

merchant_id.description: The Square-issued ID of the merchant associated with the bank account.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank that manages the account.

name.description: The name associated with the bank account.

account_number_suffix.description: The last few digits of the bank account number.

currency_code.description: The currency code of the currency associated with the bank account, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD.

type.description: The bank account's type (for example, savings or checking).

item_id.description: The ID of the variation's associated item.

ordinal.description: ndicates the variation's list position when displayed in Square Register and the merchant dashboard. If more than one variation for the same item has the same ordinal value, those variations are displayed in alphabetical order

pricing_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation's price is fixed or determined at the time of sale.

price_money.description: The item variation's price, if any.

sku.description: The item variation's SKU, if any.

track_inventory.description: If true, inventory tracking is active for the variation.

inventory_alert_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation displays an alert when its inventory quantity is less than or equal to its inventory_alert_threshold.

inventory_alert_threshold.description: If the inventory quantity for the variation is less than or equal to this value and inventory_alert_type is LOW_QUANTITY, the variation displays an alert in the merchant dashboard.

user_data.description: Arbitrary metadata associated with the variation. Cannot exceed 255 characters.

id.description: The item's ID. Must be unique among all entity IDs ever provided on behalf of the merchant. You can never reuse an ID. This value can include alphanumeric characters, dashes (-), and underscores (_).

type.description: The item's type. This value is NORMAL for almost all items.

color.description: The color of the discount's display label in Square Register, if not the default color. The default color is 9da2a6.

abbreviation.description: The text of the item's display label in Square Register. Only up to the first five characters of the string are used.

visibility.description: Indicates whether the item is viewable from the merchant's online store (PUBLIC) or PRIVATE.

available_online.description: If true, the item can be added to shipping orders from the merchant's online store.

master_image.description: The item's master image, if any.

category.description: The category the item belongs to, if any.

variations.description: The item's variations. You must specify at least one variation.

modifier_lists.description: The modifier lists that apply to the item, if any.

fees.description: The fees that apply to the item, if any.

taxable.description: Deprecated. This field is not used.

rate.description: The rate of the fee, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%.

adjustment_type.description: The type of adjustment the fee applies to a payment. Currently, this value is TAX for all fees.

applies_to_custom_amounts.description: If true, the fee applies to custom amounts entered into Square Register that are not associated with a particular item.

enabled.description: If true, the fee is applied to all appropriate items. If false, the fee is not applied at all.

inclusion_type.description: Whether the fee is ADDITIVE or INCLUSIVE.

type.description: In countries with multiple classifications for sales taxes, indicates which classification the fee falls under. Currently relevant only to Canadian merchants.

selection_type.description: Indicates whether MULTIPLE options or a SINGLE option from the modifier list can be applied to a single item.

modifier_options.description: The options included in the modifier list.

on_by_default.description: If true, the modifier option is the default option in a modifier list for which selection_type is SINGLE.

ordinal.description: Indicates the modifier option's list position when displayed in Square Register and the merchant dashboard. If more than one modifier option in the same modifier list has the same ordinal value, those options are displayed in alphabetical order.

modifier_list_id.description: The ID of the modifier list the option belongs to.

variation_id.description: The variation that the entry corresponds to.

quantity_on_hand.description: The current available quantity of the item variation.

quantity_delta.description: The number to adjust the variation's quantity by.

adjustment_type.description: The reason for the inventory adjustment.

memo.description: A note about the inventory adjustment.

role_ids.description: The ids of the employee's associated roles. Currently, you can specify only one or zero roles per employee.

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the employee.

is_owner.description: If true, employees with this role have all permissions, regardless of the values indicated in permissions.

rate.description: The rate of the discount, as a string representation of a decimal number. A value of 0.07 corresponds to a rate of 7%. This rate is 0 if discount_type is VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE.

amount_money.description: The amount of the discount. This amount is 0 if discount_type is VARIABLE_AMOUNT. This field is not included for rate-based discounts.

discount_type.description: Indicates whether the discount is a FIXED value or entered at the time of sale.

pin_required.description: Indicates whether a mobile staff member needs to enter their PIN to apply the discount to a payment.

color.description: The color of the discount's display label in Square Register, if not the default color. The default color is 9da2a6.

page_index.description: The page's position in the merchant's list of pages. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

cells.description: The cells included on the page.

page_id.description: The unique identifier of the page the cell is included on.

row.description: The row of the cell. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

column.description: The column of the cell. Always an integer between 0 and 4, inclusive.

object_type.description: The type of entity represented in the cell (ITEM, DISCOUNT, CATEGORY, or PLACEHOLDER).

object_id.description: The unique identifier of the entity represented in the cell. Not present for cells with an object_type of PLACEHOLDER.

placeholder_type.description: For a cell with an object_type of PLACEHOLDER, this value indicates the cell's special behavior.

employee_id.description: The employee to create a timecard for.

clockin_time.description: The clock-in time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The clock-out time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

clockin_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked in from, if any.

clockout_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked out from. Provide this value only if importing timecard information from another system.

role_ids.description: The ids of the employee's associated roles. Currently, you can specify only one or zero roles per employee.

clockin_time.description: The clock-in time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format.

clockout_time.description: The clock-out time for the timecard, in ISO 8601 format.

clockin_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked in from, if any.

clockout_location_id.description: The ID of the location the employee clocked out from, if any.

payment_id.description: The ID of the payment to refund. If you're creating a PARTIAL refund for a split tender payment, instead provide the id of the particular tender you want to refund. See Split Tender Payments for details.

type.description: TThe type of refund (FULL or PARTIAL).

refunded_money.description: The amount of money to refund. Required only for PARTIAL refunds.

request_idempotence_key.description: An optional key to ensure idempotence if you issue the same PARTIAL refund request more than once.

action.description: The action to perform on the order (COMPLETE, CANCEL, or REFUND).

shipped_tracking_number.description: The tracking number of the shipment associated with the order. Only valid if action is COMPLETE.

completed_note.description: A merchant-specified note about the completion of the order. Only valid if action is COMPLETE.

refunded_note.description: A merchant-specified note about the refunding of the order. Only valid if action is REFUND.

canceled_note.description: A merchant-specified note about the canceling of the order. Only valid if action is CANCEL.

id.description: The item's ID. Must be unique among all entity IDs ever provided on behalf of the merchant. You can never reuse an ID. This value can include alphanumeric characters, dashes (-), and underscores (_).

category_id.description: The ID of the item's category, if any.

color.description: The action to perform on the order (COMPLETE, CANCEL, or REFUND).

abbreviation.description: The text of the item's display label in Square Register. Only up to the first five characters of the string are used.

visibility.description: Indicates whether the item is viewable from the merchant's online store (PUBLIC) or PRIVATE.

available_online.description: If true, the item can be added to shipping orders from the merchant's online store.

available_for_pickup.description: If true, the item can be added to pickup orders from the merchant's online store.

variations.description: The item's variations. You must specify at least one variation.

category_id.description: The ID of the item's category, if any.

color.description: The action to perform on the order (COMPLETE, CANCEL, or REFUND).

abbreviation.description: The text of the item's display label in Square Register. Only up to the first five characters of the string are used.

visibility.description: Indicates whether the item is viewable from the merchant's online store (PUBLIC) or PRIVATE.

available_online.description: If true, the item can be added to shipping orders from the merchant's online store.

available_for_pickup.description: If true, the item can be added to pickup orders from the merchant's online store.

pricing_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation's price is fixed or determined at the time of sale.

price_money.description: The item variation's price, if any.

sku.description: The item variation's SKU, if any.

track_inventory.description: If true, inventory tracking is active for the variation.

inventory_alert_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation displays an alert when its inventory quantity is less than or equal to its inventory_alert_threshold.

inventory_alert_threshold.description: If the inventory quantity for the variation is less than or equal to this value and inventory_alert_type is LOW_QUANTITY, the variation displays an alert in the merchant dashboard.

user_data.description: Arbitrary metadata associated with the variation. Cannot exceed 255 characters.

pricing_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation's price is fixed or determined at the time of sale.

price_money.description: The item variation's price, if any.

sku.description: The item variation's SKU, if any.

track_inventory.description: If true, inventory tracking is active for the variation.

inventory_alert_type.description: Indicates whether the item variation displays an alert when its inventory quantity is less than or equal to its inventory_alert_threshold.

inventory_alert_threshold.description: If the inventory quantity for the variation is less than or equal to this value and inventory_alert_type is LOW_QUANTITY, the variation displays an alert in the merchant dashboard.

user_data.description: Arbitrary metadata associated with the variation. Cannot exceed 255 characters.

selection_type.description: Indicates whether multiple options from the modifier list can be applied to a single item.
